intro: Ononis praecox, commonly known as early whitlowgrass, is a flowering plant belonging to the legume family, Fabaceae. It is a low-growing annual or biennial herb that typically reaches a height of 10–30 centimeters. The plant features slender, branching stems and small, yellowish-white flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are alternate, pinnately divided, and covered in fine hairs. Ononis praecox is often found in disturbed soils, such as roadsides and fields, and is adapted to dry, sandy environments.
